cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move west then turn northwest and north-northwest across the Caribbean and enter the eastern Gulf, aiming toward the west-central Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida (near or just south of the Tampa Bay / Port Manatee area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet (only Cayman Islands/Jamaica under watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida from Fort Myers northward through Tampa Bay and Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible by late Tuesday/night and hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if the center makes landfall close to the port mid-week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the system arrives as a strong tropical storm or hurricane from the southwest, 3–6 ft of surge in Tampa Bay and adjacent Manatee County coastline is possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, leading to flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and hazardous seas disrupting vessel movements and cargo operations.
